channel.title: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)
channel.description:
Im running Windows XP Home Edition Version 2002 Sp 2 On A Compaq Presario AMD Sempron 3000+ 2.00ghz, 192 Mb Ram
THIS IS FUCKING HORRIBLE
How can i change all this to make it better?? Dont wana buy new comp -.-

item.title: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

[quote=“whip of soulz, post:13, topic:334581”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=430981.msg3164321#msg3164321 date=1269877750]

Then also explain these:
Before i added card:
[ul][]MSN - Froze my computer somtimes at login
[]MSN - Never was able to see login process because msn would temporarely freeze until logged in and list is being populated
[]MSN - Comp would lag when someone messaged me that didn’t have their chat window opened up
[]Bootup - Would take anywhere from 3-4 minutes, after i edited startup programs
[*]WebBrowsing - When scrolling around i pages, i could see the page actually shift[/ul]

After the addition:
[ul][]MSN - No longer had any problems about my computer freezing
[]MSN - I can now watch the entire login process?
[]MSN - Now i have virtually no lag when someone messages me and their window is not open
[]Bootup - Now takes about 1-2 minutes, with minimal lag
[*]WebBrowsing - No longer do i actually watch pages shift so bad. It still does, but its not nearly as bad[/ul]

Yes, my laptop is from 01 or 02, so leave it at that, it really boosted its performance. Sorry if you don’t see how.

Also, this CAN speed up your computer OR SLOW it down. It just depends on your computer. Just because something like this doesnt work for you, does not mean it wont for others. It worked for me, and 2 of my friends. Also a few others that posted in my thread about it.

Did I ever say increasing Virtual Memory wouldn’t work? No. All I said was stop treating Virtual Memory and Random Access Memory as the same thing.
[/quote]It helps if you take you’re pants off.[/quote]

Yeah, take you are pants off.

Read full topic
item.source: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)

item.source: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)

item.title: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:334581”]http://www.worldstart.com/tips/tips.php/2195

Virtual Memory serves the same purpose as RAM. When needed, RAM, and Vitual Memory are used as external memory, so the hard-drive is not needed to be used as it is a slower method.

@fantom - My computer wont even play RS until i added this extra Virtual Memory to it, so i know how you feel.[/quote]
Neither is used as ‘external memory’, unless your using USB and even that is slower than using your hard drive for Virtual memory.
Virtual memory is based off the hard-disk until you specify it as otherwise.
The read and write speed of RAM is much faster than the hard-disk thus when you set up Virtual Memory it’s slower than Physical RAM.
Your computer also uses RAM and Virtual memory for different things when it comes to memory but you probably wouldn’t understand that.
And your computer won’t play RS until you add more Virtual Memory because JAVA IS A VIRTUAL MACHINE and uses a lot of page space.

So please stop treating RAM and Virtual Memory as the same thing and perhaps do some research on it and you will see I am not just typing this to make you look stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Completely wrong, This is my Windows XP-PRO, with a windows 7 theme. Last time i checked, Paging File was the same thing as RAM

EDIT: Proof im on XP

k47a1e.png420×521

Just so you know, the ‘System Properties’, for RAM, only registers what is embedded into your motherboard, not what is there via USB as well.

Read full topic

item.title: WTF How can i upgrade my ram (cheap?)
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

CoonHunter:

Go to my forum, and look in General Discussion, i show you how to turn a 1-2GB flash-drive, or memory stick into extra RAM for your computer. Link to my forum is in my signature.

only windows vista+ can do this.
